div1.p: The captains of the 126th Pennsylvania nominate John Ault as chaplain.

dateline.name: Camp in the Field, near Fredericksburg, Va.

div1.p: At a meeting of the Field officers and Company Commanders (on duty with the regiment) of the 126th Regiment Penna Volunteers, called by James G. Elder, Col. Comdg the regiment, at his Headquarters, this date, for the purpose of, filling the vacancy in the Chaplaincy of the said regiment occasioned by the resignation of Rev. Samuel G. Niccols, on nomination made and vote had, Rev. John Ault of Loudon, in Franklin County, Pennsylvania, a regularly ordained minister of the German Reformed Church, was unanimously nominated to Col. James G. Elder, commanding the regiment, for appointment as Chaplain of the said regiment.

closer.signed:
D. W. Rowe Lieut. Col. 126th Regt. P.A.
John Dochler Capt. Com. A 126
M. H. Davison Capt. Com. B 126
B. S. Brownson Capt. Com. C. 126
W. W. Walker Capt. Co. 126 Regt.
John P. Wharton. Capt. Co. F 126 Regt
J. H. Reed Capt. Co. D
Geo. L. Miler Capt. Co. G.
John H. Walker Capt. Co. H.
A. H. Martin Capt. Co. J
A. H. Davison Capt. Co. K
